intro: Echeandia nodosa var. lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceolate nodding plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers, which are typically pink or purple, bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded to partially sunny environments.
